name: data_analysis_brief
description: 1-page data analysis section: key metrics, trends, and visual tables supporting a specific business conclusion

inputs.label: Section Title
inputs.description: Title for this data analysis section (e.g., 'Data Summary', 'Volume Analysis')

inputs.label: Key Metrics (one per line)
inputs.description: List the 3-5 most important metrics to highlight. Format: 'Metric Name: baseline â†’ current (% change)'

inputs.label: Main Conclusion
inputs.description: What is the ONE key takeaway? (e.g., 'Volume growth of 80% exceeds the 20% threshold for staffing adjustment')

inputs.label: Supporting Data Points
inputs.description: 3-4 specific data points that support the conclusion (include numbers, timeframes, implications)

inputs.label: Business Impact
inputs.description: 1-2 sentences: What does this data mean for the decision/proposal?

inputs.label: Data Source
inputs.description: Where does this data come from? (e.g., 'Operational metrics, Project notes')

sections.title: Data Summary
sections.description: Concise overview with key metrics in table format

sections.title: Key Findings
sections.description: 3-4 bullet points highlighting critical trends and implications

verification_questions.question: Can this entire analysis fit on ONE page?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: If longer than 1 page, condense further. Use tables instead of prose. Remove redundancy.

verification_questions.question: Does the analysis clearly support the main conclusion?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Every data point should connect directly to the conclusion. Remove tangential information.

verification_questions.question: Are metrics presented in tables or visual format rather than prose?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Use markdown tables for all metric comparisons. Avoid paragraph-long lists.

verification_questions.question: Is the business impact clear and actionable?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Explicitly state what decision or action this data supports.

excellent.description: Tight, 1-page format with no wasted words

good.description: Mostly concise, slight room for trimming

adequate.description: Acceptable length but could be leaner

criteria.name: Visual Clarity
criteria.description: Uses tables, bullet points, and visual hierarchy effectively

excellent.description: Tables and visuals dominate; minimal prose

good.description: Good use of tables; mostly visual

poor.description: All prose, no tables or visual hierarchy

criteria.name: Business Impact
criteria.description: Clear connection between data and business decision

excellent.description: Crystal clear why this matters for the decision
